alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:22PM CDT until March 24 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR DESOTO AND SOUTHEASTERN SHELBY COUNTIES... At 922 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in in the Memphis area near Highland and Summer and in the Lewisburg area near Olive Branch. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional light rainfall amounts are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bartlett, Southaven, Collierville, Germantown, Olive Branch, Horn Lake, Hernando, Cordova, Memphis, Walls, Southeast Memphis, Whitehaven, Midtown Memphis, Lynchburg, Eudora, Plum Point, Capleville, Parkway Village, Jago and Alden. This includes the following streams and drainages... Harrison Creek, Lake Cormorant Bayou, Harrington Creek, Marys Creek, Rocky Creek, Fletcher Creek, Johns Creek, Coldwater River, Wolf River, Field Creek, White Station Creek, Camp Creek, Duck Pond Bayou, Tenmile Creek, Johnsons Creek, Johnson Creek, Workhouse Bayou, Cypress Creek, Hurricane Creek, Black Bayou, Grays Creek, Cane Creek, Nonconnah Creek and Horn Lake Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
